document_data.name: Vanthampur
document_data.mainbody: The '''Vanthampur''' family was one of several clans of wealthy [[patriar]]s that composed the nobility of [[Baldur's Gate]]. They owed much of their success to the civil engineering they provided for the city, primarily by the family's matriarch [[Thalamra Vanthampur|Duke Thalamra]], who previously served as the city's [[Master of Drains and Underways]].
document_data.History:
{{sectstub}}
The Vanthampur family's motto is "Stone hearts never bleed."<ref>[[Adam Lee]], [[Christopher Perkins]] (September 17, 2019). [[Baldur's Gate: Descent into Avernus]]. ([[Wizards of the Coast]]), p. 36. ISBN 0786966769.
document_data.Members:
* [[Thalamra Vanthampur|Duke Thalamra]]: Raising her family from complete obscurity, Lady Vanthampur ascended to the highest governing Baldurian body, the [[Council of Four]].
* [[Amrik Vanthampur|Amrik]]: The favored son of Duke Thalamra was also the family's heir apparent.
* [[Thurstwell Vanthampur|Thurstwell]]: Eldest of the Vanthampur sons, Thurstwell kept himself locked away and spied upon the city by means of his network of [[imp]] minions.
* [[Haeril Vanthampur]]: A patriar deemed vulnerable to bribery, blackmail, or direct threats by the [[Church of Bane]] in the late 15{{th}} century DR.
* [[Mortlock Vanthampur|Mortlock]]: The youngest Vanthampur scion was kept hidden away, deep beneath the family villa.
* [[Slobberchops]]: The old and battle-scarred [[tressym]] held little allegiance to the family, least of all Thurstwell and his imps.
* [[Varri Vanthampur]]: An unwanted family member, dead in [[1492 DR]].
